_header: Forming in me the manner of my life
Note: Stanza 77 of Walton’s Boethius (2677), occurring separately; cf. 4490.
Title(s): Boethius; A blisful thynge were comyn gouernaunce
_description: ‘A blisful thynge were comyn gouernaunce’ — one 8-line stanza

PierpontB17.Transcription:
fformynge in me the maner off my lyffeLykly vnto my hevynly
                    gouernanceTechyng me to be contemplatyffeI ȝeld yowe thank with
                    lovly obseruaunceThis was a sentaunce off your ordinaunceWhich plato
                    wrote iff I it vnderstondeA blisful thynge were comyn gouernaunceyff
                    onely wyse men shold haue it on hand
PierpontB17.Note: Translating Latin prose which precedes it
PierpontB17.Editions:
Bühler,  Kurt. 
             “A Middle-English Stanza on ‘The Commonwealth and the Need for
                Wisdom.’” 
             English Language Notes
         2 (1964-65): 4-5: 4.
